summary:
An earthquake in eastern Afghanistan today killed at least 1,400 people and flattened remote mountain villages, altering an already fragile humanitarian picture. The Taliban said the scale of destruction requires immediate international aid as rescuers struggle to reach isolated communities by road and by air, and officials warned casualty figures are likely to rise. The disaster adds urgency to broader questions about access and standards for relief in crisis zones, echoing disputes elsewhere over how and when humanitarian needs are declared and met — for example contested assessments of hunger in Gaza. In the near term, international agencies and governments must mobilize coordinated search, shelter and medical operations within days before aftershocks, cold weather and blocked routes make rescue and relief far harder.

Elsewhere, world leaders met in Beijing where President Vladimir Putin urged what he called a more just global governance system, and Chinese authorities tightened security ahead of visits and a military parade — moves that can reshape trade ties, sanctions strategies and regional power calculations. Officials said a Russian strike on Kyiv killed at least 19 people, including four children, and a U.S. judge ruled the federal use of the National Guard in Los Angeles unlawful, a decision that could restrict federal intervention in local policing if upheld. Brazil's Bolsonaro faces the final phase of a trial over a 2022 coup plot, and Burkina Faso's new law criminalizing homosexuality raises rights and safety concerns.

headlines.title: Afghanistan earthquake kills at least 1,400, devastates eastern villages

headlines.summary: Putin, Modi and other world leaders attend security summit in China, signaling close cooperation on regional security and global challenges.

headlines.summary: Officials say a Russian attack on Kyiv killed at least 19 people, including four children, as the conflict intensifies near the capital.

headlines.summary: Officials clash over famine declarations as the UN and Israel dispute assessments of hunger and needs in Gaza amid ongoing conflicts.

headlines.title: Burkina Faso bans homosexuality, imposes prison sentences up to five years

headlines.summary: Prosecutors say the former president orchestrated a plan to stay in power after the 2022 election, with implications for Brazil's democracy.

headlines.title: Beijing tightens control before Xi hosts Putin and Kim at parade
headlines.summary: Officials say security measures reflect preparations for a large military parade and visits by foreign leaders, highlighting China's growing influence on the world stage.
